meanings.definition: A benign tumor composed of bone tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor discovered an osteoma during the patient's X-ray.
meanings.sent2: The osteoma on the skull was causing mild discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The little osteoma decided to throw a bone party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as solid as an osteoma, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The osteoma gleamed white on the scan, a stark contrast to the dark background.

meanings.definition: A growth of new bone tissue.
meanings.sent1: The osteoma formed slowly over several months.
meanings.sent2: His injury led to the development of an osteoma near the fracture site.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome had an osteoma that made him the envy of the other gnomes.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline grew like an osteoma, reaching higher each year.
meanings.sent5: The osteoma felt like a tiny pebble embedded in his bone, a reminder of the past injury.
